This source code is licensed under The MIT License found in the LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.

For all details and documentation: https://www.respoke.io

code:
var respoke = require('./respoke');
var log = require('loglevel');

description.full: A generic class for emitting and listening to events.
description.summary: A generic class for emitting and listening to events.

description.full: A name to identify the type of this object.
description.summary: A name to identify the type of this object.

tags.name: eventType
tags.description: - A developer-specified string identifying the event.

tags.name: listener
tags.description: - A function to call when the event is fire.

tags.name: [isInternal]
tags.description:
- A flag to indicate this listener was added by the library. This parameter should
not be used by developers who are using the library, only by developers who are working on the library itself.

description.full:
Add a listener that will only be called once to an object. This method adds the given listener to the given event in the case that the same listener is not already registered to this event and the listener is a function. The third argument 'isInternal' is used only internally by the library to indicate that this listener is a library-used listener and should not count when we are trying to determine if an event has listeners placed by the developer.

client.once('connect', function (evt) {
    console.log("This is the first time we connected.");
});
description.summary: Add a listener that will only be called once to an object. This method adds the given listener to the given event in the case that the same listener is not already registered to this event and the listener is a function. The third argument 'isInternal' is used only internally by the library to indicate that this listener is a library-used listener and should not count when we are trying to determine if an event has listeners placed by the developer.
description.body:
client.once('connect', function (evt) {
    console.log("This is the first time we connected.");
});

tags.name: listener
tags.description:
- A function to call when the event is
fired.

tags.string:
{boolean} isInternal - Internal use only. A flag to indicate this listener was 
added by the library. This parameter should not be used by developers who are using
the library, only by developers who are working on the library itself.

description.full:
Add a listener function to an object.

This method adds the listener to the event eventName.

If an identical listener already registered to this event, it will not be added.

Example of adding an event listener.
client.listen('connect', function (evt) {
    console.log("We've connected!", evt);
});
description.body:
This method adds the listener to the event eventName.

If an identical listener already registered to this event, it will not be added.

Example of adding an event listener.
client.listen('connect', function (evt) {
    console.log("We've connected!", evt);
});

tags.name: [eventType]
tags.description: - An optional developer-specified string identifying the event.

tags.name: [listener]
tags.description: - An optional function to remove from the specified event.

description.full:
Remove a listener from an object. If no eventType is specified, all eventTypes will be cleared. If an eventType is specified but no listener is specified, all listeners will be removed from the specified eventType. If a listener is also specified, only that listener will be removed.

client.ignore('connect', connectHandler);
description.summary: Remove a listener from an object. If no eventType is specified, all eventTypes will be cleared. If an eventType is specified but no listener is specified, all listeners will be removed from the specified eventType. If a listener is also specified, only that listener will be removed.

tags.name: eventType
tags.description: - A developer-specified string identifying the event to fire.

tags.name: evt
tags.description:
- Any number of optional parameters to be passed to
the listener

description.full: Trigger an event on an object. All listeners for the specified eventType will be called. Listeners will be bound to the object ('this' will refer to the object), and additional arguments to fire() will be passed into each listener.
description.summary: Trigger an event on an object. All listeners for the specified eventType will be called. Listeners will be bound to the object ('this' will refer to the object), and additional arguments to fire() will be passed into each listener.

tags.string: {boolean} Whether this event has any listeners that are external to this library.

description.full:
Determine if an object has had any listeners registered for a given event outside the library. This method checks for the isInternal flag on each listener and doesn't count it toward an event being listened to. This method is used in the library to handle situations where an action is needed if an event won't be acted on. For instance, if a call comes in for the logged-in user, but the developer isn't listening to {respoke.Client#call}, we'll need to reject the call immediately.

if (client.hasListeners('call')) {
    // already handled!
}
description.summary: Determine if an object has had any listeners registered for a given event outside the library. This method checks for the isInternal flag on each listener and doesn't count it toward an event being listened to. This method is used in the library to handle situations where an action is needed if an event won't be acted on. For instance, if a call comes in for the logged-in user, but the developer isn't listening to {respoke.Client#call}, we'll need to reject the call immediately.
